title: Blank page on clicking "start annotation"
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

- Create a new text classification project (single label) using the default admin user (started doccanno via docker as directed in the README). 
- 
```
$ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS                    NAMES
384f60a548d0        doccano/doccano     "/doccano/tools/run.â€¦"   About an hour ago   Up About an hour    0.0.0.0:8000->8000/tcp   doccano
```

- Add some test data (see export attached to this ticket)
- create a new user via the admin interface with "annotator" permissions
- add the new user to the project
- login as the new user
- try to annotate data (see gif)

![Peek 2022-06-09 13-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4342641/172935161-502acc92-82c6-4ee5-bc45-846dcba0f913.gif)

Exported annotations: 
[3a5604e5-48db-4617-a174-5c6e8d4f4405.zip](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/files/8873577/3a5604e5-48db-4617-a174-5c6e8d4f4405.zip)

Although I didn't see anything useful in it I have also attached the console log here: 
[localhost-1654805503523.log](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/files/8873590/localhost-1654805503523.log)


Note this is likely similar/related to https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1741 although we took different steps to reproduce so I wasn't sure if this should be its own ticket or not


Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: ubuntu 20.04
*   Python Version Used: n/a
*   When you install doccano: today 
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker container (latest)
